document.heading: Government Employer-Assisted Housing Amendment Act of 1999

history.narrative: Law 13-96, the “Government Employer-Assisted Housing Amendment Act of 1999,” was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 13-451, which was referred to the Committee on Economic Development. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on November 15, 1999, and December 7, 1999, respectively. Signed by the Mayor on December 29, 1999, it was assigned Act No. 13-225 and transmitted to both Houses of Congress for its review. D.C. Law 13-96 became effective on May 9, 2000.
